means: 使习惯于(accustom的过去式和过去分词)

sentence.Network_en: Possibly we are accustomed, biologically speaking, to this background radiation.
sentence.Network_cn: 从生物机理上说，我们可能已经习惯了这种本底辐射。

sentence.Network_en: Bradley is still accustomed to travelling everywhere in style.
sentence.Network_cn: 布拉德利仍然保持着每次出行必派头十足的习惯。

sentence.Network_en: The team has accustomed itself to the pace of first division rugby.
sentence.Network_cn: 球队适应了英式橄榄球甲级联赛的节奏。

encyclopedia.content: 【读音】：英音：[ə'kʌstəmd]美音：[ə'kʌstəmd] 【翻译】：adj. 惯常的，通常的。 【用法】：be accustomed to doing sth 【例句】： —They are quiet, aren’t they? —Yes. They are accustomed to not talking at meals.

entry.def: If you are accustomed to something, you know it so well or have experienced it so often that it seems natural, unsurprising, or easy to deal with.

example.ex: I was accustomed to being the only child at a table full of adults...
example.tran: 我已经习惯了作为唯一一个小不点坐在一桌大人中间。

example.ex: She had not yet become accustomed to the fact that she was a rich woman.
example.tran: 她还不太适应已经是一个富婆的事实。

entry.tran: （眼睛对光线变化）习惯了的,适应了的
entry.def: When your eyes become accustomed to darkness or bright light, they adjust so that you start to be able to see things, after not being able to see properly at first.

example.ex: My eyes were becoming accustomed to the gloom.
example.tran: 我的眼睛渐渐适应了黑暗。

entry.def: You can use accustomed to describe an action that someone usually does, a quality that they usually show, or an object that they usually use.

example.ex: He took up his accustomed position with his back to the fire...
example.tran: 他背对着炉火在通常的位子上坐了下来。

example.ex: Freed acted with his accustomed shrewdness.
example.tran: 弗里德以他一贯的精明风范行动起来。

means.word_mean: 1. (often followed by `to') in the habit of or adapted to;

auth_sentence.content: You're accustomed to cycling being a low priority.
auth_sentence.res_content: You're accustomed to cycling being a low priority.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: You're accustomed to cycling being a low priority.

auth_sentence.content: He was a wary man, accustomed to disappointment.
auth_sentence.res_content: He was a wary man, accustomed to disappointment.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: He was a wary man, accustomed to disappointment.

auth_sentence.content: His wife, who seemed accustomed to such remarks.
auth_sentence.res_content: His wife, who seemed accustomed to such remarks.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: His wife, who seemed accustomed to such remarks.

stems_affixes.type_exp: 表形容词,通常在动词后,"有……的,被……的"

stems_affixes.value_cn: 通常的,习惯的,按照风俗习惯的
stems_affixes.word_buile: accustom使习惯+ed有……的,被……的→通常的,习惯的
ally同盟者+ed有……的,被……的→allied联合的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 耕耘的,有教养的,栽植的
stems_affixes.word_buile: cultivate耕耘,栽植+ed有……的,被……的→cultivated耕耘的
harden变硬+ed有……的,被……的→adj.变硬的,坚毅的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 受伤的,受损害的,受委屈的
感兴趣的,有成见的,有权益的
stems_affixes.word_buile: interest兴趣,关心+ed有……的,被……的→adj.感兴趣的,有成见的,有权益的
limit限制+ed有……的,被……的→adj.有限的,被限制的
note注意到+ed有……的,被……的→被注意的→著名的
pack打包+ed有……的,被……的→adj.充满……的,塞满了……的
repeat重复,反复+ed有……的,被……的→adj.重复的,再三的
suppose猜想,推测+ed有……的,被……的→adj.假定的,假像的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 坏的,邪恶的,缺德的,不道德的
stems_affixes.word_buile: wick+ed有……的,被……的→adj.坏的,邪恶的,缺德的,不道德的
fix固定+ed有……的,被……的→adj.固定的,确定的

Sentence.sentence: Students who are accustomed to living in dorms.

sentences.en: This is his accustomed hour to go to bed.
sentences.cn: 这是他就寝的惯常时间。

sentences.en: They are accustomed to this sort of work.
We have got accustomed to living in an air-conditioned room.
sentences.cn: 我们对生活在有空调的房间里已习惯了。

jushi.english: He drove with his accustomed, casual ease.
jushi.chinese: 他驾轻就熟逍遥自在地开着车子。

jushi.english: This is his accustomed hour to go to bed.
jushi.chinese: 这是他就寝的惯常时间。

jushi.english: He took his accustomed seat by the fire.
jushi.chinese: 他在炉火边惯常坐的座位上坐了下来。
